trans-unit.source: Upgrade the operating system of compute nodes in a pool
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the operating system of compute nodes in a pool

trans-unit.source: Upgrades the operating system of compute nodes in the specified pool.
trans-unit.target: Upgrades the operating system of compute nodes in the specified pool.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to pools.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to pools.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: POST
trans-unit.target: POST

trans-unit.source: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that you want to upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that you want to upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: targetOSVersion
trans-unit.target: targetOSVersion

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.

trans-unit.source: For permitted values, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For permitted values, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: 202.
trans-unit.target: Status code: 202.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: During an upgrade, the Batch service upgrades each compute node in the pool.
trans-unit.target: During an upgrade, the Batch service upgrades each compute node in the pool.

trans-unit.source: When a compute node is chosen for upgrade, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and returned to the queue to be rerun later (or on a different compute node).
trans-unit.target: When a compute node is chosen for upgrade, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and returned to the queue to be rerun later (or on a different compute node).

trans-unit.source: The node will be unavailable until the upgrade is complete.
trans-unit.target: The node will be unavailable until the upgrade is complete.

trans-unit.source: This operation results in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to be upgraded.
trans-unit.target: This operation results in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to be upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Although the Batch service tries to avoid upgrading all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the pool may be temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
trans-unit.target: Although the Batch service tries to avoid upgrading all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the pool may be temporarily unavailable to run tasks.

trans-unit.source: When this operation runs, the pool state changes to <languageKeyword>upgrading</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: When this operation runs, the pool state changes to <languageKeyword>upgrading</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: When all compute nodes have finished upgrading, the pool state returns to <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: When all compute nodes have finished upgrading, the pool state returns to <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: While the upgrade is in progress, the pool’s currentOSVersion reflects the OS version that nodes are upgrading <legacyItalic>from</legacyItalic>, and targetOSVersion reflects the OS version that nodes are upgrading to.
trans-unit.target: While the upgrade is in progress, the pool’s currentOSVersion reflects the OS version that nodes are upgrading <legacyItalic>from</legacyItalic>, and targetOSVersion reflects the OS version that nodes are upgrading to.

trans-unit.source: Once the upgrade is complete, currentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
trans-unit.target: Once the upgrade is complete, currentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
